result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacques R Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the stipulated restitution in the amount of $1200 to BP and $360.88 to Mobil Sunrise, from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Court set matter over to allow the State to obtain any additional restitution information to 9-11-14 at 1:30pm. Defendant to appear by video.

Pay balanc(s) remaining of the DNA surcharges, restitution, costs, disbursements and supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy. Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and all other surcharges from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.
No contact with and keep separate from co-defendant Gillium Henry Miller (14CF486)

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Court ordered that the defendant as a convicted felon he may not possess a firearm or body armor

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Ravi B., Lawrence D., or Elmogheera H., Gopal S., or Lisa S.
No contact with BP gas station at 1930 West Morgan Ave, city and count of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with BP gas station at 7532 West Center Street, city of Wauwatosa, county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with Citgo gas station at 6001 West Cleveland Ave, city and county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with Lake Bluff Shell gas station at 1425 North Farwell Ave, city and county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with the Mobil Sunrise gas station at 3870 South Howell Ave, city and county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No contact with Mid-Town at 641 North Hawley Road, city of Wauwatosa, county of Milwauke, Wisconsin.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Urine screens.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/counseling.
Voting rights are restricted until they are restored.

Restitution Refund Packet
Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. spc
Count 1.
/Amending Judgment of Conviction to add "joint and several" to the restitution portion, with co-defendant in 14CF486, signed and filed.  Copies mailed to ADA Jim Frisch and Attorney Craig Powell.

Defendant Jacques R Johnson in court by video with attorney Craig S. Powell.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the court that it has received no additional restitution for today's hearing date from remaining victims.  Restitution remains as previously ordered with no additional amounts added on today's date.
/regarding restitution information submitted by the State, received and filed.
Justice Point report, filed.
/in support of defendant, received and filed.
/(2) and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Defendant Jacques R Johnson in court with attorney Craig S Powell.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to all counts:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   
Court ordered that the defendant as a convicted felon he may not possess a firearm or body armour, and his voting rights are restricted until they are restored.
On motion of state, Court ordered a presentence investigation.  Order for Presentence Investigation received and filed; copy to Probation Dept.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to Br. 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Jacques R Johnson in court with attorney Craig S Powell.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, parties request an adjournment.  Court granted joint request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Justice Point report received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Jacques R Johnson in court with attorney Craig S Powell.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case continued for projected guilty plea before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for scheduling conference. Notice of Retainer received and filed. Attorney Powell has been privately retained in this matter and is still waiting for discovery from prior counsel. Defense counsel requests bail hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jacques R Johnson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Jacques R Johnson in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
